Russia has already lost over 15,000 units of armored vehicles and 6,000 tanks, and is forced to use outdated models, such as the T-54, which were scrapped over 40 years ago. Western analysts agree that the success or failure of the Ukrainian operation under Kursk may significantly affect the further course of the war. At the same time, the unity of Western countries in supporting Ukraine remains important, which will be a key factor in countering Russian aggression. Tim Shipman notes that the only British weapon that has not yet been used on Russian territory is also the most powerful - the Storm Shadow. Since this cruise missile is a joint project, its use also requires the consent of the US and France (where the missiles are called Scalp), which fear escalation in relations with Russia. news knowledge.eng_title: Ukraine's Kursk Offensive: Experts Predict Three Possible Scenarios
news knowledge.summary: Ukraine's surprise offensive in the Russian region of Kursk has resulted in the control of 28 settlements, with 1000 square kilometers of territory gained. Experts predict three possible scenarios for the further course of the Ukrainian-Russian conflict. The least likely scenario is a further Ukrainian advance within the Kursk region. 'The Ukraine will continue its advance in Kursk,' explained military analyst Andrew Perpetua on social media platform X (Twitter). Reports of a halt to the offensive are 'FSB propaganda,' according to independent expert Andrew Perpetua. The second scenario is that Ukraine will fortify its positions to hold onto the territory it has gained. 'This is the riskiest option, as Ukrainian positions have several small outposts that could be easily cut off,' explained Australian military expert Mick Ryan from the 'Lowly Institute' in Sydney. The third and most likely scenario is a sudden Ukrainian withdrawal as soon as Russia redeploys its air force and artillery. 'It could be sensible for Ukraine to withdraw from the area as soon as Russia reorients its air force and artillery,' said a German military expert. The most favorable scenario for Ukraine would be a sovereign and undefeated withdrawal from Russia, allowing it to maximize the political and strategic benefits of the operation and retain a large stock of experienced combat troops for future operations in 2024 and 2025.
